data.title: Social Games – Advice from Experts – Clarity
data.text:
Sandra Wong is CEO & founder of Lucky Lady Games & Stashlink. She specializes in Casual Gaming & Business Development Strategy and is an app / game designer & online marketing specialist with a 20+ year background in technology product development. She specializes in building technology products, user acquisition, app monetization, UIUX, design audits, live dealer casino blockchain technology. She has consulted for 50+ private and public companies across multiple industries and was a nominee for Leader of the Year by Woman of Worth Awards. Sandra has launched apps that debuted at number one in its category and in the top 100 in appStore. She has been an integral part of over 25 app projects with some enjoying traffic numbers in the millions. Sandra was the Success and Product Manager at BlueBat Games for clients including Foxwoods, Treasure Island, Hard Rock, Seminole and was design consultant to VGW - Virtual Gaming Worlds & Global Poker. You can read more about her on Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sandrawong/

Serial Entrepreneur; raised $300MM+ for startups of my own and paid engagements. Currently helping grow an innovative young company that has patented and built the definitive platform for modernizing Loyalty Programs via blockchain technology. Spent prior four years redefining largest Loyalty program in the hotel industry with over 110MM members, and annual program revenues in excess of $5BN. Also serve on the Boards of Loyyal Corp, and GrowLife (PHOT). Former Director of Founder Institute's LA chapter, and still the highest rated Mentor in the history of Founder Institute overall. Previously: COO of Omnia Media a fast-growing YouTube multi-channel network in the music and gaming media categories. Raised $12MM in funding and successfully sold within 4 years. Former sr. exec / exec @ X PRIZE Foundation, Atari, Bigpoint, Wazap, Yahoo!, Microsoft, Ashton-Tate. Founder Institute Mentor, Angel investor, parallel entrepreneur.

Founder of Thrust Interactive (2004). Thrust has created over 100 games and apps for it's clients, some of the largest consumer brands in the world. Founder of Thrust Games (2011). An indie game studio creating mobile cross-platform games. Founder of True or False Games (2013). TFG licenses a mobile, multiplayer turn-based trivia platform. Founder of Creativity GameLab (2014). CGL implements a proven process for leveraging the creative muscle of an organization to solve unique and difficult challenges. President of the Atlanta Chapter of IGDA (International Game Developers Association). We bring together game developers to improve their lives and craft. Advisory Board Member: TAG Entertainment Society, Atlanta Regional Commission Arts & Culture Committee, Metro Atlanta Chamber of Commerce’s Digital Coalition, APPNation Atlanta, Atlanta Game Developer Meetup, Atlanta Unity3D User Group, Atlanta Corona User Group. 40 Under 40, Atlanta Business Chronicle's Class of 2012

CEO Level Up Consulting | Ex EA & Playtika | Mentor, Google | Kellogg MBA | Engagement specialist helping B2C software companies answer the consumer question: "What's In It For Me?" I'm a 10+-year veteran of the consumer software industry, and I've held leadership and creative roles on iconic, award-winning entertainment franchises like The Sims, for industry-leading companies like Electronic Arts (EA) & Playtika. From mega-launches with massive marketing budgets to lean new IP projects, from multiple-million selling games to mobile/social apps with a million daily active users, my experience spans many platforms, genres, & target demographics, and I have won multiple awards for delivering high-quality results. I hold a marketing & technology MBA from the Kellogg School of Management. As a B2C Product Mentor at multiple startup accelerators including Google, I regularly give 'office hours', where I sit with the various companies and advise them on their most pressing product issues. That's exactly what I'm offering via Clarity.

For the last 17 years I have been employed as Business development Director/CEO at a small number of game development/publishing businesses. Primarily facilitating the commercial means to support and sustain creative and technical excellence in the development of world class products according to the game development mantra – “on time, within budget and to an exceptionally high standard”. I have negotiated and secured countless development, distribution and publishing deals and contracts, routinely deal with legal advisors and have raised £m’s in in grant and equity funding. I am a confident presenter, an effective communicator and a strong team player. Business development and blue chip key account management is my forte. 12 years ago, I secured $10m equity investment and established a Cambridge HQ for Midas Interactive. I employed the management team, secured the product development strategy and put an effective global sales and distribution structure in place. 10 years ago I acquired, via Gameware Europe Ltd., all of the assets and IP in world renowned Cambridge studio Creature Labs Ltd. and now own the historic ‘Creatures’ and ‘James Pond’ IP which are commercially exploited via ongoing publishing partnerships(Creatures online via Bigben, James Pond – Robocod via System 3, digital via Merge Games). Gameware have recently delivered the iOS/Android app “Man United Tricks” together with a proprietary ad server for Zoombugs Ltd with the intention to build upon the MU app via social engagement – developing interactive products that effectively engage and build the fan/community user base. Gameware also delivered 4 series of the BAFTA nominated TV gameshow Bamzooki – empowering users to create 3D creatures online and interact with their user generated digital creations in real time. Connected TV, mobile, PC ++ screens provide a direct to user global communication channel and therefore a huge opportunity for talented, nimble and well funded digital creatives to develop and iterate digital products for global audiences whilst maximising D2C revenues.

Digital Product Manager and Entrepreneur. I enjoy solving problems with products and services. I have cofounded and codirected an internet startup (Wemories). I've also worked designing, prototyping, developing and pitching entertainment products for iOS, web, Wii, DS, PS3, XBOX 360 and PSP. I believe in: 1. Putting ideas in front of users and customers as soon as possible. 2. Listening and observing the people who is using the product to understand: what's working, what's not working and why. 3. Improving the product in quick iterations, always having the business goals in mind. 4. Focusing on marketing only when people want the product.

I'm a serial entrepreneur and software engineer; sold three companies and built apps and games on iOS and Facebook reaching close to 100 million users. Having always been passionate about education I am now building products that help people learn on mobile devices. Got my start co-founding an online restaurant business in college and developed skills in sales, running large distributed workforces, and building systems to collect and manage large complex data sets. Since then I discovered I'm pretty good at creating contexts where people want to do things online. Specialties include social games, iOS games, viral mechanics, virtual currency based systems and micro transactions. Occasionally I enjoy investing in and advising early stage startups. I find purpose in empowering people to realize their potential, making the world more efficient and human beings better able to manipulate their environment.
